text:
STUDIOS—UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON
CHANNEL
KCTS-TV
TRANSMITTER—EDISON TECHNICAL SCHOOL
SEATTLE 5, WASHINGTON
December 28, i960
Dear Bills
As I wired you this morning, following receipt of your
wire, I can make a meeting in New York on Monday, Janc
9th, allright.
I am delimited that conversations seem to have progressed
to the point where it seems practical to get the
executive committee to meet with Jack*
I can fly into new York on Sunday so can meet anytime
Monday morning. Do you want to have someone make me
hotel reservations for late arrival Sunday night, and
let me know where it will be. Also let me know how
long the meeting should take — I*11 book return space on
Tuesday, but could stall not more than another day if
need be. I have meetings here the latter part of the
week — Thursday and Friday, so need to get home.
Does someo ie want to advance me plane fare — it is
$377.19 RT first class, Seattle to NY. If NAEB is
footing the travel bill, I'd be glad to fly Coach at
$30lu92.
Loren B. Stone
Manager
Bill Harley
NAEB
Washington, D. C0
University of Washington Seattle Public Schools,* King County Schools Seattle University a Seattle Pacific College Seattle Public Library
